attachments.title: eBay’s First Chief Diversity Officer on Humanizing Diversity and Inclusion
attachments.text: Damien Hooper-Campbell is on a mission to generate more authentic, effective conversations about diversity and inclusion. Here's how you can join him.
attachments.fallback: eBay’s First Chief Diversity Officer on Humanizing Diversity and Inclusion

text: a friend of mine at intel is working on an anti-harassment tech stack and has offered us beta invites to beta test. it has some training data - looks like lifted from at least reddit, and you can "play" the categorization of things as harassing or not. you can also plug in your twitter and see what the machine learning thinks of your own messages, which is cool. one thing im hoping is that a few folks with purview on our web projects from either tech or administrative sides take an interest; i recall doing a lot of user web projects where comments were either excluded due to UGC risk, or added with a complex bunch of manual management to allow comments in... a self-healing tech stack is pretty cool. intel just wants to sell chips so this could be a path forward to both help communities have more healthy and safe online conversations, and potentially attach a brand a little more to the notion of diversity and inclusion.
so yeah, LMK if you want to get an invite to this web product.
